document.masterDocTitle: Nematomorpha from the Philippines, with description of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Nematomorpha from the Philippines, with description of two new species

subSubSection.paragraph: ( Figures 1 C–H, 3A–E)

Nine specimens were found with a more or less smooth cuticle, which did not allow further identification within the genus
Gordius
. These specimens are only briefly mentioned here. Collecting locality, sex, hosts or potential hosts and the accession numbers are listed in Table 1 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Gordius jorriti
n. sp.
, holotype. A. Smooth cuticle under low magnification. B. Fine surface structure including spine-like structures (encircled). C. Ventral view on posterior end with position of the cloacal opening (co) and the postcloacal crescent (pcc). Arrows point at the precloacal row of bristles, dotted squares indicate position of figures D and E. A large artefactual structure (art) is present on the cuticle. D. Fine structure of bristles, arrows indicate some branched bristles. E. Fine spines on the posterior margin of one tail lobe.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gordius
sp. (specimen 1). Length 450 mm , diameter 1.7 mm . Medium brown with dark collar. Smooth cuticle ( Fig. 1 D).

Gordius
sp. (2, 3). With smooth cuticle ( Fig. 1 E, F). Specimen 2 is 310 mm long and has a diameter of 1.2 mm , specimen 3 is 305 mm long and has a diameter of 1.3 mm . Both specimens are medium brown in color, a dark collar is present, but weak in specimen 3.

Gordius
sp. (4). Length 545 mm , diameter 0.8 mm . Medium brown with dark collar. Cuticle smooth ( Fig. 1 G) and with no special characteristics at the posterior end ( Fig. 1 H).

Gordius
sp. (5). Length 290 mm , diameter 1.6 mm . Medium brown with dark collar. Cuticle not in good shape, with irregular elevations not resembling native cuticular patterns ( Fig. 3 A). Otherwise smooth cuticle.

Gordius
sp. (6). Length 170 mm , diameter 1.0 mm. Very light in color, almost whitish. The dark collar present is hardly visible. Darker coloration around the cloacal opening. Cuticle smooth ( Fig. 3 B).

Gordius
sp. (7). Length 605 mm , diameter 1.3 mm . Medium brown with dark collar and clearly visible dorsal and ventral darkly pigmented longitudinal lines along the body. Cuticle smooth ( Fig. 3 C).

Gordius
sp. (8). Length 665 mm , diameter 1.0 mm. Medium brown with dark collar and clearly visible dorsal and ventral darkly pigmented longitudinal lines along the body. Cuticle smooth with some longitudinal irregular ridges in some parts of the body ( Fig. 3 D).

Gordius
sp. (9). Length 280 mm , diameter 1.3 mm . Light brown with faintly visible dark collar. Cuticle smooth ( Fig. 3 E).
